page.title: 04GROBY VILLAGE HALL.
page.content: The village hall,which stands on Main Street near the Newtown Linford Road junction,has only been in existence since 1980.It used to be the Martinshaw Primary School until then. When the last remaining infant classes were moved to the main school the premises became vacant. In the beginning there was no heating and nothing to sit on.For their first meeting the Village Hall Committee had to sit on camping stools and boxes.The first public events were a flower show and a pantomime both successful.Although the hall is in use,work has not been completed yet.It needs to be decorated,a notice board is required and the general facilities need improving.The Committee is keen to let the building to almost any group,even those from the next village Ratby.
